answerText: acetone [or CH3 CO CH3][10] This arene, the simplest to contain a hydroxyl group, can be synthesized somewhat tediously by the sulfonation of benzene. It can also be produced by the Raschig-Hooker process.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Minnesota A and Dartmouth A and South Detroit University | 13 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Ancient Organic Chemistry textbooks describe how this compound can by synthesized by strongly heating Barium Acetate. For 10 points each:  [10] Identify this compound which is detected in the Reynold's test due to its ability to dissolve "freshly precipitated" mercuric oxide. It can also be produced by the oxidation of isopropanol.
